scenes.background: [Monica] taps her fingers on the table. You advocated for patience.
scenes.description: Bob raises an eyebrow. 'Are we just supposed to wait and see? We need results now.'

options.text: Results take time, but we can set short-term goals to track progress more closely.
options.analysis: You suggest a balanced approach of patience and short-term tracking, showing good self-regulation and moderate skills in other areas.

options.text: I get it, but maybe we need to prioritize and focus on the most critical tasks first.
options.analysis: You show empathy by acknowledging the urgency and suggest prioritization, but your motivation to stick to the original plan is lower.

options.text: If immediate results are necessary, we might need to rethink our current strategy entirely.
options.analysis: You suggest a radical approach, showing high motivation and social skill but lower emotional perception and self-regulation.
